documents.summary: This document explains how to configure komorebi to handle applications that minimize to the system tray or use multiple windows to prevent leaving blank tiles.

documents.title: Design
documents.summary: This document outlines the internal architecture and hierarchical data model of the komorebi window manager, explaining how monitors, workspaces, and containers relate to one another.

documents.title: Index
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of komorebi, a tiling window manager for Windows, including its core functionality, community resources, and specific licensing terms for personal and commercial use.

documents.title: Example configurations
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide for setting up and customizing the komorebi tiling window manager and whkd hotkey daemon on Windows using example configurations. It explains how to manage layouts, application-specific settings, and keyboard shortcuts through JSON and RC files.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for installing and setting up komorebi, a tiling window manager for Windows, covering various installation methods and system optimizations.

documents.title: Troubleshooting
documents.summary: This document provides troubleshooting steps and solutions for common issues encountered when using the komorebi tiling window manager, including hardware-specific display bugs and configuration errors.

documents.title: Focusing windows
documents.summary: This document explains the various commands and configurations for navigating and focusing windows within the komorebi window manager.

documents.title: Focusing workspaces
documents.summary: This document explains how to navigate and focus workspaces using various komorebic commands, including methods for focusing by index, name, direction, and monitor.

documents.title: Moving windows across workspaces
documents.summary: This document explains how to move or send windows between workspaces and monitors using various komorebi CLI commands, including support for cycling and named workspaces.

documents.title: Moving windows
documents.summary: This document explains how to move and reorder windows within workspaces and across monitors using komorebic commands and configuration settings.

documents.title: Stacking windows
documents.summary: This document explains how to manage window stacks in the komorebi tiling window manager, including commands for stacking, unstacking, and navigating windows within a stack.
